account_id.label: Netsuite account ID
account_id.comment: To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for "Account ID"

email.label: Netsuite account email
email.comment: The email address of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

password.label: Netsuite account password
password.comment: The password of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

role_id.label: Netsuite account role id
role_id.comment: The role id of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite. To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for the "ID" value in the user list.

netsuite_base_url.label: Netsuite Base url
netsuite_base_url.comment: The base url as you access it via the browser, e.g. https://system.na1.netsuite.com/

email.label: Netsuite account email
email.comment: The email address of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

password.label: Netsuite account password
password.comment: The password of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

role_id.label: Netsuite account role id
role_id.comment: The role id of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite. To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for the "ID" value in the user list.

connection_import_recordtype.label: Import Connection Settings For Record Types

account_id.label: Netsuite account ID
account_id.comment: To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for "Account ID"

email.label: Netsuite account email
email.comment: The email address of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

password.label: Netsuite account password
password.comment: The password of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

role_id.label: Netsuite account role id
role_id.comment: The role id of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite. To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for the "ID" value in the user list.

email.label: Netsuite account email
email.comment: The email address of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

password.label: Netsuite account password
password.comment: The password of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

role_id.label: Netsuite account role id
role_id.comment: The role id of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite. To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for the "ID" value in the user list.

email.label: Netsuite account email
email.comment: The email address of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

password.label: Netsuite account password
password.comment: The password of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite

role_id.label: Netsuite account role id
role_id.comment: The role id of the web service user you have defined in Netsuite. To get this value, go to Setup->Integration->Web Services Preferences in Netsuite and look for the "ID" value in the user list.

send_orders.label: Enable sending orders to Net Suite

get_order_changes.label: Enable getting order changes/deletions from Net Suite

get_shipments.label: Enable getting fulfillment data from Net Suite

get_cash_sales.label: Enable getting cash sale/invoice data from Net Suite

get_stock_updates.label: Enable getting stock updates from Net Suite

get_products.label: Enable getting product data from Net Suite

get_creditmemo.label: Enable getting Credit Memo data from NetSuite

export_batch_size.label: Export message limit
export_batch_size.comment: The maximum number of messages that are to be exported (sent to) Netsuite in a single cron run

import_batch_size.label: Import message limit
import_batch_size.comment: The maximum number of messages that are to be imported (processed from) Netsuite in a single cron run

timeout.label: Timeout
timeout.comment: In case processing an element fails, the element is added back to the queue. The timeout specifies the number of seconds that needs to pass so the item is considered for re-processing

updated_from_minutes.label: Import items updated in last N minutes
updated_from_minutes.comment: The import queue will consider only items updated in at most this number of minutes

customer_form_id.label: Customer form id
customer_form_id.comment: If the customer export does not work, got to Netsuite admin->Setup->Customization->Entry Forms and set this value to the internal id of another form, e.g. "Standard Customer Form". Your Netsuite default form may ask for more required information than Magento is able to provide

netsuite_link_field.label: Netsuite field which holds the link to Magento
netsuite_link_field.comment: Advanced setting, do not edit unless you are sure about its effects

magento_link_field.label: Magento field which holds the link to Netsuite
magento_link_field.comment: Advanced setting, do not edit unless you are sure about its effects

saved_search_for_sync_id.label: The id of the saved search used for product sync

field_map.label: Field Mapping
field_map.comment: Map Magento product attributes to Net Suite fields. For "standard" Net Suite fields, see the InventoryItem object in SuiteTalk documentation

price_level_netsuite_id.label: Price level to grab the price from
price_level_netsuite_id.comment: The price levels are visble at Setup->Accounting->Accounting Lists, then switch to "Price level"

sync_product_images.label: Sync product images
sync_product_images.comment: The images of the products will be controlled by Net Suite, "Item Display Thumbnail" and "Item Display Image"

image_sync_on_update.label: Sync product images on update
image_sync_on_update.comment: If this is set to no, image sync will happen only for new products

default_website_ids.label: New product default web site ids

default_attribute_set_id.label: New product default attribute set id

netsuite_mapping.label: Mapping between Magento and Netsuite shipping methods
netsuite_mapping.comment: To see the defined shipping methods in Netsuite and their internal IDs, go to Lists->Accounting->Shipping Items

nesuite_default_shipping_id.label: If none of the rules above match, use this Netsuite shipping item internal id:
nesuite_default_shipping_id.comment: To see the defined shipping methods in Netsuite and their internal IDs, go to Lists->Accounting->Shipping Items

tracking_mapping.label: Mapping between Magento Tracking number types and Netsuite shipping methods
tracking_mapping.comment: To see the defined shipping methods in Netsuite and their internal IDs, go to Lists->Accounting->Shipping Items

send_tracking_information_on_import.label: Send tracking information when receiving tracking numbers from Netsuite

price_level.label: Default price level
price_level.comment: The price levels are visble at Setup->Accounting->Accounting Lists, then switch to "Price level"

netsuite_mapping.label: Mapping between Magento and Net Suite payment methods
netsuite_mapping.comment: To see the defined shipping methods in Netsuite and their internal IDs, go to Setup->Accounting->Accounting Lists, then change type to "Payment method"

processor_mapping.label: Mapping between Magento payment methods and Net Suite payment processors
processor_mapping.comment: To see the defined credit card processors in Netsuite and their internal IDs, go to Setup->Accounting->Credit Card Processing

customer_classes.label: Customer tax class for Netsuite-imported sale taxes

product_classes.label: Product tax class for Netsuite-imported sale taxes

not_taxable_internal_netsuite_id.label: "Not Taxable" code internal Net Suite id
not_taxable_internal_netsuite_id.comment: The id can be found in Net Suite at Setup->Accounting->Tax Codes

order_location.label: Location Internal Id
order_location.comment: The internal id of the location the products will be substracted from stock. The list is available at Setup->Company->Locations in Netsuite

adjustment_account_id.label: Adjustment account netsuite internal id
adjustment_account_id.comment: When adding new products in Magento, they are copied to Net Suite along with their original stock if they do not exist. Go to Setup > Accounting > Chart of Accounts to get a list of accounts.

custom_search_id.label: Saved stock search internal id
custom_search_id.comment: A custom search must be defined to allow stoc updates. This has a very specific format. Refer to the documentation on how to create one.

custom_search_page_size.label: Page size for the saved search query

update_stocks_every_n_hours.label: Update the stocks every N hours

terms_id.label: Terms Internal Id
terms_id.comment: The ids can be found in Netsuite at Setup->Accounting->Accounting Lists, "Term" type

class_id.label: Class Internal Id
class_id.comment: The ids can be found in Netsuite at Setup->Company->Classes

department_id.label: Department Internal Id
department_id.comment: The ids can be found in Netsuite at Setup->Company->Departments

sales_rep_id.label: Sales Rep Internal Id
sales_rep_id.comment: The ids can be found in Netsuite at Lists->Employees

location_id.label: Location Id
location_id.comment: The list is available at Setup->Company->Locations in Netsuite

custom_fields_mapping.label: Custom fields that are to be synched between Magento and Net Suite
custom_fields_mapping.comment: Define the fields in Net Suite at Setup->Customization->Transaction body fields. We only support the freetext type.

set_tran_id.label: Set the tranid field to the order increment_id
set_tran_id.comment: Disable this if you do not want/allow custom transaction ids. Note that you should define a custom field in Net Suite to grab the increment id if you still want to keep a relation between the order objects.

invoices_netsuite_type.label: Netsuite equivalent for a Magento invoice

email.label: Developer E-mail
email.comment: Warning emails will be sent to this email address

export_queue_threshold.label: Export queue threshold
export_queue_threshold.comment: If the export queue has more elements than defined here, an email is sent to the developer. An ever-growing queue is a sign of processing being stuck. Set to zero to disable.

import_queue_threshold.label: Export queue threshold
import_queue_threshold.comment: If the export queue has more elements than defined here, an email is sent to the developer. An ever-growing queue is a sign of processing being stuck. Set to zero to disable.
